result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Werch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive 18 days of sentence credit.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $194.89 & restitution surcharge of $19.49 - Paid in full.  Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the restitution and court costs.

1.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
2.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
3.    Defendant is to undergo, participate in and successfully complete alcohol and drug abuse assessment and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
Court costs totalling $443.00 - Paid in full.  Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the restitution and court costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (03/16/2018)

1:18 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent not present in court.  Statement by the Court - reads letter received from the Agent.  Court questions defendant regarding payment.  Statement by the defendant.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.  Further statement by the court - informs the defendant that if he does not comply before the next discharge date, the court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:21 p.m.

Talked with defendant's step dad, defendant has a doctor appointment today and really needs to attend that.  Informed him that I spoke with Agent Jill Ellis, she is going to request an extension of his probation for one year and that she is not able to appear tomorrow (2/14) at 1:00 p.m. as she has training, but defendant will need to appear in court.

10:26 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - will proceed to plea & sentencing.  DA recites plea agreement, 2014CF78 will plea to count 1 amended to Carrying concealed weapon as repeater in violation of 941.23(2) and will plea to count 4, 2014CF125 defendant will plea to count 1 amended to Misdemeanor BJ.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant will enter a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to amended count 1 and count 4 on 2014CF78 and amended count 1 on 2014CF125.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 on 2014CF78 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF78 (counts 1 & 4)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs
Restitution $194.89
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
AODA assessment

Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the restitution and court costs, and any balance be applied to 2014CF125

18 days of sentence credit if revoked.

2014CF125

TIME SERVED
court costs - $200 bond on file is to be applied to the fine and costs.
